thread.title: Central Elkader claims victor over Turkey Valley
thread.title_full: Central Elkader claims victor over Turkey Valley

author: Mark Woodley
title: Central Elkader claims victor over Turkey Valley
text:
Central Elkader claims victor over Turkey Valley Posted: Friday Night Heroes Catch all the high school football highlights during the regular season and playoffs, get live score updates and vote for the Play of the Week and the Game of the Week! More >> Catch all the high school football highlights during the regular season and playoffs, get live score updates and vote for the Play of the Week and the Game of the Week! More >> More >> 
Someone would leave this game as the last undefeated team remaining in this district. 
Second quarter - Turkey Valley up 8, 6 - Central Elkader - getting a bit of luck - the tipped pass ends up getting Ben Backes down to the 1 yardline. 
3 plays later - it's Zach Grant - apparently working for us tonight wasn't enough - Grant gives the Warriors a 12, 8 lead. 
but Turkey Valley would drive right back the field - Wyatt Blazek picking up some big yards - gets the Trojans inside the 15. 
that would lead to the second touchdown of the night from Cody Hackman - 3 yards -16, 12 Turkey Valley. 
but just before half - Central strikes again - Derek Ehrhardt downfield to Ben Backes - Backes gets down to the 4 with 5 seconds to go. 
and on the next play - Backes on the reverse sends Central to half with a 20, 16 lead. 
and the second half turned in to the Derek Ehrhardt show - from the 17 - hits Nick Sylvester for the score -26, 16 Warriors. 
Next drive - -Ehrhardt again - this one to a lunging Ted Hilgerson - down to the one - they'd score on the next play to go up 32, 16. 
and then Ehrhardt hit the big one - deep downfield to Backes - nobody's going to catch him as he'll go 58 yards for the score. 
Central Elkader stays unbeaten with a 66-34 win. 
Derek Ehrhardt/Central Elkader Quarterback "We got things figured out at the end of the half. Second half proved that we figured things out at halftime. I took charge, was the best leader I could be, and it turned out alright." 
Tom Wilwert/Central Elkader Head Coach "We were able to stay close enough that the second half, when the defense started to figure it out, we were still in the game in good position." Can't Find Something? 500 Fourth St. Waterloo, IA 50703 News: (319) 291-1200
